title: Wargame Design: Addressing the Trilemma
bluf: Defines the wargamer’s trilemma—analytical utility vs. realism vs. playability—and gives design tactics to recover rigor and repeatability.
relevance: Method foundations for instrumenting open-ended language-based games so LLM runs yield analyzable data.

best_fit_citations.how_to_use: When describing control/treatment and repeatable designs for language games.

title: Wargames as Data: Addressing the Wargamer's Trilemma
bluf: Blueprint for collecting reliable, repeatable data from wargames: sampling, randomization, adjudication transparency, and analysis.
relevance: Direct playbook for turning free-form, LLM-driven play into datasets with treatments and measurement.

best_fit_citations.how_to_use: Method section when you explain experimental design and telemetry for LLM agents.
